task.comment: The task to be performed. Optdensity solves for the electronic structure to selfconsistency. Calculation performs a one-shot evaluation of calctype (see below) without selconsistency.

comment.default: Specify the path of needed files.

sub_temp.comment: Output all the temporary files of subsystems.

comment.default: Control the charge density optimization of global system.

econv.comment: Convergence threshold for energy, it will divided by the number of atoms.

pconv.comment: Convergence threshold for potential. Default is 'econv'/1E2.

ncheck.comment: How many step satisfy the convergence.

olevel.comment: The level of output energy, large will faster.
olevel.note: Only set 0, the energy of each cycle is useful.

maxtime.comment: Maximum execution time. Non-positive number means no time limit.

olevel.comment: The level of output energy, large will faster.
olevel.note: Only set 0, the energy of each cycle is useful.

restart.comment: Start the job from new one, scf results or restart from previous run.

maxtime.comment: Maximum execution time. Non-positive number means no time limit.

optfft.comment: Optimize the number of grid points.

file.comment: The input density file for initial density.

output.comment: The output file or format of density. The name starts with '.' represent the format.

comment.default: The way to decompose the subsystem to more subsystems

method.comment: 'manual' means use the given subsystem; 'distance' means base on the distance of atoms to decompose the subsystem.

adaptive.comment: The decompose method after first step, 'manual' will remove all 'NSUB'.

rcut.comment: The cutoff for decompose the subsystems.

radius.comment: The radius of each elements for decompose the subsystems.

comment.note: Subsystem(`SUB`_) use :ref:`cell-index<cell-index>` to define the atoms in the subsystem.

file.comment: The file name of input structure. Many file formats are available. We use `ASE's I/O <https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/ase/ase/io/io.html#module-ase.io>`_.

split.comment: Cut small cell for each direction (scaled).

cut.comment: Base on the subsystem atoms build the small cell, and add the vacuum on each direction. 0 means use whole cell.

index.comment: The indices of the atoms, support integer and slice.
index.note: If not only a slice, you should given the stop for the slice.

optfft.comment: Optimize the number of grid points.

file.comment: The input density file for initial density.

output.comment: The output file or format of density. The name starts with '.' represent the format.

initial.comment: Default is None, which means engines determine the initial density by themself. 'temp' means initial density from engine temporary output. 'atomic' means base on the atomic density files or pseudopotentials initialize the density.

atomic.comment: If :ref:`density-initial<density-initial>` set the Atomic, here can set each elements atomic density.

use_gaussians.comment: It will replaces the core densities of the surrounding fragments with a gaussian. This is to avoid problems of electrons leaking in the core region of surrounding fragments when hard pseudopotentials are employed.

gaussians_scale.comment: The scale of each elements. If not set, will use the number of core electrons.

comment.default: The way to decompose the subsystem to more subsystems

method.comment: 'manual' means use the given subsystem; 'distance' means base on the distance of atoms to decompose the subsystem.

adaptive.comment: The decompose method after first step, 'manual' will remove all 'NSUB'.

rcut.comment: The cutoff for decompose the subsystems.

radius.comment: The radius of each elements for decompose the subsystems.

scheme.comment: Density mixing scheme, default is with driver's own scheme.

maxm.comment: Maximum of iterations used for mixing.

delay.comment: Delay several step to mixing the density.

restarted.comment: Restart the mixer after several step.

kf.comment: Similar as predcoef, not use now.

comment.default: Control the charge density optimization for subsystem.

update_sleep.comment: Subsystem will wait several steps then update.

update_delay.comment: Delay several steps to evaluate the update frequency.

method.comment: The method for generate the kpoints.

subs.comment: The name of all subsystems in this subsystem.

nprocs.comment: The number of processors for the subsystem.
nprocs.note: If the minimum of all subsystems is 1, can also be used as ratio of number of processors for each subsystem.

embedpot.comment: The output file or format of embedding potential. The name starts with '.' represent the format.

exttype.comment: The embeded potential type, which is same as `embed`.

basefile.comment: The base input file for subsystem.

prefix.comment: The prefix of each subsystem. If not set, it's same as the name of subsystem.

task.comment: The task to be performed for subsystem. Only works for JOB-task = Optmix.

charge.comment: The charge of molecules or atoms.
